tuv.seg: Adoption and cohabiting couples
Uchtáil agus lánúineacha comhchónaithe
The non-marital family is not recognised by the Irish Constitution and it does not possess the same legal rights and obligations as the family based on marriage
Níl aon aitheantas tugtha don teaghlach neamhphósta faoi Bhunreacht na hÉireann agus níl na cearta agus oibleagáidí dlíthiúla céanna aige agus atá ag teaghlach atá bunaithe ar phósta
Under the Adoption Act 2010, a child may be adopted by married couples, a mother or father of the child or a relative of the child
Faoin Acht Uchtála 2010, is le lánúineacha pósta, athair nó máthair an linbh, gaol leis an leanbh, leanbh a uchtú
In specific cases, the Adoption Authority of Ireland may decide that it is desirable that some other person can adopt a child
I gcásanna sonracha, féadfaidh Údarás Uchtála na hÉireann cinneadh a dhéanamh go mbeadh sé inmhianaithe go bhféadfadh duine éigin eile an leanbh a uchtú
Unmarried couples may not jointly adopt a child
Ní féidir le lánúineacha neamhphósta leanbh a chomhuchtú
A joint adoption by a couple is only possible where that couple is married and living together
Ní féidir leo an leanbh a chomhuchtú ach amháin nuair atá siad pósta agus ina gcónaí le chéile
This rule prevents an unmarried couple from jointly adopting a child even where one of the parties is the biological or legal parent of the child
Cuireann an riail seo cosc ar lánúineacha neamhphósta leanbh a chomhuchtú fiú amháin más tuismitheoir bitheolaíoch nó dlíthiúil an linbh duine acu
There are no proposals to change adoption law in Ireland to permit adoption by unmarried couples
Níl moltaí ar bith ann go n-athrófar an dlí uchtála in Éirinn le cead a thabhairt do lánúineacha neamhphósta leanbh a uchtú

Under the adoption legislation, it is possible for a single person to adopt if the Adoption Authority considers it desirable and it must regard the welfare of the child as its first and paramount consideration

De réir na reachtaíochta uchtála, is féidir le duine singil uchtú a dhéanamh má mheasann an tÚdarás Uchtála go bhfuil sé inmhianaithe agus ní foláir dó leas an linbh a ghlacadh mar an gcéad ní agus an ní is tábhachtaí
This means that if you are living with a same-sex or opposite-sex partner, you may apply to the Authority to adopt a child in your own right, intending to raise the child with your partner

Ciallaíonn seo, má bhíonn tú i do chónaí le páirtí comhghnéis nó malairtghnéis, féadfaidh tú iarratas a dhéanamh ar an Údarás chun leanbh a uchtú as do stuaim féin agus tú ag dréim leis an leanbh a thógáil aníos le do pháirtí
However, your partner would have no legal rights in relation to the child
Bíodh sin mar atá, ní bheadh cearta dlíthiúla ar bith ag do pháirtí maidir leis an leanbh
The fact you are in a relationship is relevant only when evaluating circumstances that might affect the child's welfare
Cé go bhfuil tú i gcaidreamh, ní bhaineann tábhacht leis seo ach amháin nuair a bhíonn na cúinsí á measúnú a d’fhéadfadh difear a dhéanamh do leas an linbh
For a foreign adoption to be recognised in Ireland, it must comply with the definition of adoption in Irish law
Chun uchtáil choigríche a bheith aitheanta in Éirinn, caithfidh sí cloí le sainmhíniú na huchtála faoi mar a shonraítear é i ndlí na hÉireann
This means that the rule that only married couples may jointly adopt will apply
Ciallaíonn sin go mbeidh an riail i gceist nach bhféadfaidh ach lánúineacha pósta comhuchtú a dhéanamh
Step-parent adoption refers to the adoption of a child by the birth mother (usually) and her spouse, who is not the birth father of the child
Tagraíonn uchtú ag leastuismitheoir uchtú linbh ag an máthair bhreithe (de ghnáth) agus a fear céile, nach athair breithe an linbh é
If only her spouse adopted the child she would lose her rights and responsibilities in relation to the child and would no longer be the child's guardian
Dá ndéanfadh a fear céile amháin an leanbh a uchtú, chaillfeadh sí a cuid cearta agus freagrachtaí maidir leis an leanbh agus ní bheadh sí mar chaomhnóir an linbh a thuilleadh
As mentioned previously they must be married to each other for both of them to be able to adopt
Mar a luadh cheana, ní mór dóibh bheith pósta lena chéile má tá an bheirt acu in ann uchtú
They will then both be adoptive parents
Beidh siad beirt ina dtuismitheoirí uchtaíocha ansin
You can find out about step-parent adoption on the Adoption Authority's website
Is féidir leat faisnéis a fháil faoin leastuimitheoir uchtála ar láithreán gréasáin Údarás Uchtála na hÉireann
When a child is being adopted there is a requirement to consult the birth father
Nuair a bhíonn leanbh á uchtáil, tá riachtanas ann go rachfaí i gcomhairle leis an athair breithe
If the birth father is a guardian his consent is required
Má tá an t-athair breithe ina chaomhnóir, ní mór a thoiliú a fháil
You can read more about adoption and consent here
Is féidir leat tuilleadh faisnéise a léamh faoi uchtú agus faoi thoiliú anseo
Further information about adoption is available from your local Child and Family Agency adoption service
Tá tuilleadh faisnéise ar fáil faoi uchtáil ó an Ghníomhaireacht um Leanaí agus an Teaghlach
